snippet: The agreement, Uber’s latest attempt to ease concerns about its labor model, establishes benefits for drivers but stops short of unionization.
abstract: Uber announces it has reached agreement with International Assn of Machinists and Aerospace Workers union to create Independent Drivers Guild for New York City drivers; organization will grant company's drivers in city some benefits and protections; association, which stops just short of being union, is first of its kind to receive official backing from company.

byline.original: By NOAM SCHEIBER and MIKE ISAAC

lead_paragraph: The agreement, Uber’s latest attempt to ease concerns about its labor model, establishes benefits for drivers but stops short of unionization.

headline.main: Uber Recognizes New York Drivers’ Group, Short of a Union
headline.print_headline: A Guild, Short of a Union, for New York Uber Drivers

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Assn of Machinists and Aerospace Workers
